The first term of Equation (12) captures the apparent instability of the nose: an advance of the nose to higher
x n
accelerates its rate of advancement. The stabilizing factor is the subsequent increase in

relating population dynamics, Equation (11), to antigenic evolution of pioneer strains described by Equation (12). Taken together Equations (11-13) define a Differential Delay (DD) system of equations. Sample simulations of this stochastic DD system are shown in Figure 4 BC.
